intro: Astragalus muradicus var. egirdirensis, commonly known as the Egirdirensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties. Its conservation status is of concern due to habitat loss and over-collection.
